metadata.title: CVE-2016-1586 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A malicious webview could install long-lived unload handlers that re-use anincognito BrowserContext that is queued for destruction in versions ofOxide before 1.18.3.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1586` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
